intro: Bunchosia gracilis, commonly known as the slender bunchosia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Bunchosia gracilis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
